intro: Lappula diffusa, commonly known as common lappula, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has smooth, branching stems covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads, which are characteristic of the genus Lappula. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy surface. The plant is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas, roadsides, and waste grounds.
